alert.note: Alert for Big Island East; Big Island North (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued July 16 at 3:42AM HST until July 17 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING NOW EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MONDAY FOR SOUTH FACING SHORES OF ALL ISLANDS... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM SUNDAY FOR EAST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .Historic south swell out of the 170 to 190 degree direction will produce dangerous waves along south facing shores today through Sunday. A combination of large surf and regular predicted water levels could lead to flooding of beaches that typically remain dry, especially at and around the peak daily tide. The combined elevated, rough trade wind swell and swells generated by Tropical Storm Darby will produce advisory level surf for east facing shores of the Big Island through tonight as the storm weakens and passes south of the islands. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 8 to 12 feet. * WHERE...East facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution.

area.areaDesc: Big Island East; Big Island North
